citations.narrative:
Currently there is no barrier between the public and the enclosures housing the goats and pig, and no attendant present.
This is not designed as a contact yard and when an attendant is not present, a barrier of sufficient distance must be in
place to assure the safety of the goats and the public.
Correct by: Oct 28, 2023

A rabbit is housed in an enclosure in which 10-20% of the linoleum or laminate flooring has been chewed away, exposing
the wooden floor beneath. This presents a risk of injury from ingestion of foreign material. Further, the enclosure is no
longer in good repair and cannot be cleaned and maintained appropriately. Rabbits must be housed in enclosures that are
structurally sound and are maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to facilitate sanitation.
Correct by: Nov 1, 2023.

The lighting within a barn housing multiple mammals is inadequate. Due to poor electric maintenance of the facility,
overhead lighting in the skunk and porcupine enclosures is inconsistent. Single windows within the affected enclosures
are too small to provide adequate lighting on their own. Together, these conditions mean the animals are housed in
inappropriately dark conditions for much of the day, making observation and sanitation difficult. Lighting within enclosures
should be of good quality, distribution, and duration as appropriate, and of sufficient intensity to promote routine
inspection and cleaning.
Correct by Nov 9, 2023

The chicken shelter/coop needs to be addressed. There are cleaning tools stored in the coop up against the walls that are
not secured. This can pose a potential hazard to the chickens when they are active in the coop and tools shift or fall. In
addition, there is an excessive amount of dust on the fans and lights that needs to be cleaned. Housing facilities must be
kept neat and free of clutter to promote good housekeeping practices for the health of the birds.
The area outside the vulture enclosure needs to be addressed. Currently the facility is pulling the indoor/outdoor carpet
that is soiled and leaving it indoors adjacent to the enclosure. This is contributing to a strong odor in the area. To promote
good housekeeping, soiled carpets should be removed and cleaned prior to being storing in the area.
Correct by: Oct 31, 2023

Several bird species are housed in the mews behind the main building that were recently winterized. The lighting in the
enclosures is not working properly and several times it would begin to flicker and then just go out, leaving the pigeon in
darkness. The lighting in this area needs to be addressed to assure the birds have a natural light cycle with lighting that is
on for the duration of the daylight hours.
Correct by Nov 9, 2023

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
Although the facility provides enrichment to the birds, they do not have an environmental enhancement plan in place to
promote the overall psychological well-being of the birds at the facility. Exhibitors must develop, document and follow a
species appropriate plan for environmental enhancement to promote the psychological well being of the birds that is
within industry standards and approved by the veterinarian. Additionally, this plan must address under 3.154 c(3) the
special considerations for the single housed turkey vulture that does not have access to hear and see other bird species.
The plan must be made available for future inspections.
Correct by: Nov 1, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Jason Sifkarovski, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.131(c)(1) 
   
Handling of animals. 
Currently there is no barrier between the public and the enclosures housing the goats and pig, and no attendant present. 
This is not designed as a contact yard and when an attendant is not present, a barrier of sufficient distance must be in 
place to assure the safety of the goats and the public.

3.50(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
A rabbit is housed in an enclosure in which 10-20% of the linoleum or laminate flooring has been chewed away, exposing

longer in good repair and cannot be cleaned and maintained appropriately. Rabbits must be housed in enclosures that are 
structurally sound and are maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to facilitate sanitation.

3.126(c)

The lighting within a barn housing multiple mammals is inadequate. Due to poor electric maintenance of the facility,

3.150(b)

The chicken shelter/coop needs to be addressed. There are cleaning tools stored in the coop up against the walls that are

The area outside the vulture enclosure needs to be addressed. Currently the facility is pulling the indoor/outdoor carpet

3.151(c) 
   
Facilities, indoor 
Several bird species are housed in the mews behind the main building that were recently winterized. The lighting in the 
enclosures is not working properly and several times it would begin to flicker and then just go out, leaving the pigeon in

3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
Although the facility provides enrichment to the birds, they do not have an environmental enhancement plan in place to 
promote the overall psychological well-being of the birds at the facility. Exhibitors must develop, document and follow a 
species appropriate plan for environmental enhancement to promote the psychological well being of the birds that is

The plan must be made available for future inspections.  
Correct by: Nov 1, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
